website_summaries.verdict: Surprisingly affordable considering its high durability, Grizzly Tarps are an excellent investment for protecting cars, boats, and motorcycles.
pros: Available in a wide range of sizes
cons: The tarp is tough, but its grommets could be stronger

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it! Pay a little more for something that lasts!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tarp on 5-28-2018 to cover a boat (which is also covered by a factory boat cover). This product is sold as “UV resistant” but after barely two months, it tore in three places from simply removing it as a result of sun exposure (we have received almost no rain in the last two months). After a quick look over I found that the tarp had deteriorated to being paper thin. I attempted to e-mail the manufacturer and their e-mail address isn’t even valid. Steer clear if you are looking for something that lasts. Honestly, I have spent less for tarps that have lasted nearly two years!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tarp
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know why this doesn’t have 5 stars overall, it works perfectly fine and is exactly as described in the specs. People who ding this tarp either don’t like the color brown and want to whine about it or are using it to cover a cactus or something and wondering why it’s shredding
customer_reviews.author: Wouts

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: I was taking a chance when buying this tarp because the reviews were like 50/50 on it but i loved it. I used it for my camping trip to top my tent and it was FANTASTIC!!! It served 2 purposes... 1 for shelter from the rain and 2 because of the reflective side from the sun and it qas great!! Definitely buying this again when it wears out
customer_reviews.author: ValMMGA

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go under an intex pool. Somehow, grass still managed to grow thru the tarp and the pool liner, resulting in a leak that I had to patch. This liner is supposed to be heavy duty but it doesn’t even stop grass from growing thru it. The rest of the tarp has worked fine under the pool so maybe it is just a thin spot. I will use the rest of the summer and buy a thicker, more expensive one next year for under the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Christen Dowling

customer_reviews.title: It disintegrates in the sun after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, (I should have learned after the first). These are probably good if you use it indoors but I use it to cover my boat, which is outdoors and the material starts to flake then powder and fall apart with absolutely no abuse. I have reached out to the mfg to see what the warranty is but the seller says these are great for the outdoors. I say nay nay!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Arnone

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and thick tarp. Leak proof. Highly reccomend. Very thick.
customer_reviews.text: We used these to cover an RV with a hole in roof and to make a temporary ceiling to keep heat in living room. These aren't the typical flimsy harbor freight tarps. Very thick and durable. Kept all the heavy Florida and Alabama rain out with no leaks. When we used as temporary drop ceiling did not melt from the heat of being 7 ft over top of fireplace. Very well made and excellent to have around for all kinda of uses.
customer_reviews.author: Hoops

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like it's said won't buy it again never
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed it was nothing like it said its all ready falling apart tearing all over its really bad 👎 👎 👎 👎 👎 I purchased tis tarp on January 2018 not even a year and is all torn
customer_reviews.author: Maty Jim

customer_reviews.title: twice the price of similar tarps
customer_reviews.text: my wife bought a 10' x 12' tarp at twice the price of what is typically found at big box stores. i was hoping that for the price it would be extra resilient in comparison, but i'm very dissapointed. it's been in use for 2 weeks (light duty) & i've already got a hole in it somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: holding strong so far
customer_reviews.text: After two months and a few winter storms, this tarp is still holding strong as a temporary roof over my temporary straw bale chicken coop. I have it staked down very firmly through the grommets and they have held nicely even with some very strong wind. The thickness is great for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Mamalaoshi

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Two of the grommets were bent. And the black reinforced corners were not strong enough. Had the tarp up for shading a dog pen. And in 10mph wind the back corner store off completely leaving the gromet attached to the hook and the tarp flapping in the wind. Disappointed. Using it to cover items in a garage now and bought a canvas one for the dog pen.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Not what’s pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Only had it a day, so I can’t speak for durability. But the time is not as pictured. I wanted the tarp shown, silver in one side and black on the other. They sent me a silver one with a chocolate-brown backing.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, reinforced corners, great size! Worked great for under our 9X10 foot tent providing a good size landing area as well. Well made and easy to fold, not stiff like so many tarps. Anticipate many good years out of this tarp!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Beachem

customer_reviews.title: Mildew/Mold!
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak for its durability or its sturdiness or its value, since it just arrived. However the paperwork clearly states that its mildew proof. And there is clearly mildew or mold that you can see through the plastic packaging. The Mildew/ Mold is spreckled on the paper and on the front area of the tarp where I took the photos. Unfortunately I don't think I have the time to replace this item. I will try and see if this is the only area where the mildew/mold is located or if there are other areas on the tarp.
customer_reviews.author: AB San Bruno

customer_reviews.title: I thought this would provide good temporary shelter until I could find a more permanent ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tarp since we were expecting rain in Socal this past weekend. Being that I have outdoor furniture that needs to be protected from the elements, I thought this would provide good temporary shelter until I could find a more permanent solution. I'm not sure how the other reviewers tore the grommets off. I have secured the tarp to my fence with bungee cords and it is holding up just fine, even with strong winds. Sturdy material, would purchase a second one just to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Hoa N

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I used this tarp for gardening - hauling leaves and plant materials. The first one tore on the very first day, so I ordered a replacement. Maybe it was defective? Nope. The second lasted two or three days. I understand it’s not a expensive purchase, but it claims to be heavy duty and that is just not the case. The items I’m hauling are not that heavy and a “heavy duty” tarp should last MUCH longer then a few days. I will not purchase from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: John Persak

customer_reviews.title: Durability concern
customer_reviews.text: This B-Air Grizzly Tarps I just used only 8 months, and it is starting falling apart as paint was flaking and when I touched the tarp and it fell apart like dust. I was trying get in touch with seller, but no use. Need another better tarps so I look some where else. I do not know what else to say, and not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ty H.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last at all.
customer_reviews.text: This is tarp lasted 7 months before it self destructed. This is the second time I’ve bought this exact tarp. They last less than a year. Don’t waste your money if you plan on using it in full sun as a cover. It can’t handle the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for under outdoor inflatable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tarp to go in my side yard under a large inflatable waterpark. Our side yard is more like a field with sticks, rocks, etc., so I wanted a thicker tarp for protection. After two days of use, I am very happy with the thickness and quality of this tarp. It has been easy to clean too!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't live up to what's described
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the UV protection and I used it to cover a small Greenhouse to protect that plastic. It took only one year and this tarp is now confetti, I am sure it'll work well with other purposes and it felt strong but let it sit in the Sun for just half the day if that and it won't make it a year
customer_reviews.author: Bill nick

customer_reviews.title: It does a good job
customer_reviews.text: The B-Air Grizzly Tarp is nice and thick and has plenty of grommets. I use it outdoors to protect my Jet Skis from the sun and elements. But if you live in Arizona, in the valley, don’t expect it to last much more than a year and a half or so. It does a good job until that time!
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT wast your money this is a scam
customer_reviews.text: I think they call them grizzly tarps cause after 2 months (no severe weather maybe some light rain and wind here and there) it looks like it got attacked by a grizzly bear. I highly recommend saving the money and not buying this product. It was so bridal after the first month it just started to fall apart. Mother nature protected my snowmobiles better then this tarp. Never written a review on Amazon but this is a scam and I’d hate to see people wast there money. Photo taken after 3 months of covering my snowmobiles what was supposed to be all summer. And not to count that it started to rip right around 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: decent tarp
customer_reviews.text: decent tarp. feels fairly well made and is doing the job currently. havent been using it for more than 1 month but its holding up well. I have used thicker tarps but this isn't an industrial type tarp either so i cant ding it for that.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last the first storm
customer_reviews.text: Used it over a carport for lawn mowers and such. Didn't last the first light windstorm. Ripped right down the middle all the way across. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with the quality of this tarp! It has only been a few weeks since I purchased this tarp and it is already decaying rapidly. I can see the sky through this tarp and it is unravelling on the ends. Very poor quality!
customer_reviews.author: Valeca Neal

customer_reviews.title: Tarp is poor in durability and design is defective along seams
customer_reviews.text: Poor manufacturing of product. Almost like the silver was painted on and tarp is already disintegrating. Since this is a silver tarp you would expect it to be heavy duty but unfortunately is is not even same quality of what you would expect from a blue tarp. I would recommend you go with another manufactured 10 mil product. This one did not appear to be as thick as other 10 mil products. Not happy but just slipped the return window when I made the observation yesterday.
customer_reviews.author: FlFisherman

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for making a tarp shelter when camping!
customer_reviews.text: This product is super tough, relatively light for its size, and absolutely waterproof as claimed! The silver side also reflects heat quite well when used as a camp shelter, and is great protection against UV when used as a cover. Something many outdoors enthusiasts will appreciate!
customer_reviews.author: Roy Richards

customer_reviews.title: this lasted one summer
customer_reviews.text: The tarp looked great when it came - heavy duty looking. I'm not sure how long a tarp is supposed to last, but this one split after one summer. Granted, our California sun is intense and we have some pretty scorching days ..... but I thought it would at least last a few seasons.
customer_reviews.author: S. Simon

customer_reviews.title: the tarp is working great.
customer_reviews.text: strong and durable tarp to cover our broken hot tub. We put plywood, connected with smaller and shorter wood pieces, and have the wooden top sits on top of the 8x9 tub surface. Since the tub is outdoor, we have to use the tarp to cover the wood top to protect it. It has been raining for the whole week, the tarp is working great.
customer_reviews.author: othwyn

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My tarps get a lot of use out here on my farm: covering hay, straw, farm equipment. So far they are strong, grommets are not ripping out. I'm very happy with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Secretariat

customer_reviews.title: great for tent footprint
customer_reviews.text: I use this tarp as a footprint underneath my 8x8 tent. It works great, is easy to fold up, and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Durable, long lasting.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to protect my items inside a moving self-packed moving pod. It was definitely large enough to cover everything and it did a great job at ensuring that everything inside the pod stayed nice and dry. What's nice is that when I finished using it for storage, I was able to fold it back up and throw it into a trash bag to use again. It is so durable and will last quite a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C.

customer_reviews.title: Thick and durable
customer_reviews.text: I live in windy, sunny Texas, so a sturdy tarp is essential. This tarp is nice and thick, and has sturdy grommets. I use as a ground cover.
customer_reviews.author: bah

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with this Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to cover important boxes during a remodel. Had to move alot of my stuff to the 2nd floor outside deck and covered it with this for 2 weeks, it rained and snowed and none of the boxes got wet, very impressive
customer_reviews.author: Craig DiLullo

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty tarp. Used this for camping to keep the tent dry during a rainy camp weekend. Works as good as the heavy duty ones at the stores for half the price
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Enoch

customer_reviews.title: BEST DARN TARP I'VE EVER OWNED
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS TARP.. WENT TO BUY ANOTHER ONE AND THEY SAY THEY ARE OUT OF THEM.. I WANT TO KNOW WHEN THEY WILL BE CARRYING MORE OF THESE?????
customer_reviews.author: THE OLD ONES

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tarp in Feb 2019 and installed it. Last month it started ripping and now large portions are torn. I tried tearing it by hand, and it took almost no force to rip it. Not a product worth buying. I'll go back to the silver tarps, which last at least 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: As good as any and a good price
customer_reviews.text: Did not last a real long in direct sun but I bought a second one because nothing else did either.
customer_reviews.author: Jehu

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This covered a Table & Chairs all winter. It held up to winds, rain & snow of Illinois. I would recommend &but this again.
customer_reviews.author: MOM_2MANY

customer_reviews.title: Good tarp for the price
customer_reviews.text: Heavy tarp, but the islets dont handle the wind whipping the tarp as well as some i have had but will still buy it again because the price was reasonable for heavy material.
customer_reviews.author: EVe

customer_reviews.title: More expensive - but a premier tarp for any use case imaginable
customer_reviews.text: Great tarp for any use case, including hauling or creating a false bottom in a trailer or truck. Love the tarp and the grey/silver color is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and buy elsewhere!
customer_reviews.text: Pure junk! Worthless crap again, ripped in several places and rotting everywhere after maybe 3 months in California sun.
customer_reviews.author: fixitall45

customer_reviews.title: Works good for 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: It get sun damage after 6 months but will probable last a year, if hope. Price was good.
customer_reviews.author: Roger G. Solheid

customer_reviews.title: Dont wast money
customer_reviews.text: Used it to cover a framed in wood pile. Sun and rain destroyed it in 5 weeks. Buy a treated canvas one and spray with sunblock once in a while. Cost will be cheaper in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: M P.

customer_reviews.title: Silver/brown not silver black. And too short.
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed so far. First of all the 10-foot side is only about 9 foot 10 at best. Second of all it is not silver and black the backside that should be Black is Brown. It also has a strong chemical smell.
customer_reviews.author: Yoda82

customer_reviews.title: 12x20 no way.
customer_reviews.text: Was not 12 by 20 as stated and the company does not tell you the finished measurements. Needless to say did not fit. So waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Peters

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty with emphasis on Heavy
customer_reviews.text: If you need a tarp that could protect the bottom of your tent from rocks and sticks, this one will do. It's thick and heavy so don't expect to take it back packing or anything. If you're using it to cover things, it's a bit stiff. I've only used it as a tent footprint and for that purpose, it serves me well.
customer_reviews.author: Yoshihiken

customer_reviews.title: Tuff
customer_reviews.text: I used this top as a temporary repair for my wood shed roof so far it has worked beautifully it is a heavy gauge well-made tarp and I would buy again
customer_reviews.author: New England Redneck

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic quality, heavy duty. I've had this tarp covering the shavings bin for my barn for two months now and it still looks new.
customer_reviews.author: Forrestgrunt

customer_reviews.title: They were supposed to be heavy duty, but they ...
customer_reviews.text: They were supposed to be heavy duty, but they have shredded. We need something to cover our haystack for the Winter and obviously this wasn't it. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tarp for use to block sun from RV
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement trap. First one lasted 2 years before sun and wind caused it to fail.
customer_reviews.author: Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tarp for the price
customer_reviews.text: Price is amazing for this tarp it is pretty thick. It has nice metal rings seems sturdy
customer_reviews.author: ZSki Fpv

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item in December of 2019. Unfortunately 5 months later it tore. I couldn’t get a refund or an exchange for the damaged item. Not a good buy. I do not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Martinez

customer_reviews.title: worked really well!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cover a storage 'locker'. It is decently thick and working well so far!
customer_reviews.author: Sia

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Better than most cheaper tarps. Been through wind and rain and grommets are still good, No tears
customer_reviews.author: bryanna murray

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't last! I used it for just over a month as a cover over my factory boat cover and it fell apart. It looked like two skinnier covers glued together down the center.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Not UV resistant!  Does not hold up
customer_reviews.text: Got this tarp in 12 x 20 for shelter over my bee yard. Installed end of June 2019. By October it was a pile of shreds. I thought by paying more I got a better product. Not the case.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wahl

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but size was off
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave it two stars is because it was supposed to be 10 by 12 but it was 10 by 12 and 1/2 but I made it work for my needs...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the wood nice and dry, seems pretty good so far and thicker then anything I've seen at Home Depot or Lowe's
customer_reviews.author: Mike Giannos

customer_reviews.title: Nice tarp. Strong enough to hold up through hurricane ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice tarp. Strong enough to hold up through hurricane Irma...looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Richards

customer_reviews.title: Worst tarp on Amazon not uv treated
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tarp in Jan and a little over 6 months later and it's tearing in half from getting brittle from the sun even though the ad says uv treated and the metal rings for the tigh downs rip right out when you tigh it down snugg worst tarp I ever purchased definitely should warranty this Amazon or not sell them anymore
customer_reviews.author: Derek D.

customer_reviews.title: More durable, more grommets.
customer_reviews.text: Better than those blue tarps at the local hardware and lumber stores. It also has more grommets, which is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: charlescouncill

customer_reviews.title: Ron Swanson Would Approve of This Tarpaulin
customer_reviews.text: Needed some sturdy tarps for some back yard summer fun. These did the trick well.
customer_reviews.author: RCTia

customer_reviews.title: Nice and heavyweight tarp.
customer_reviews.text: This tarp is heavyweight and perfect for covering my coop. Chickens stay dry when it rains. I like the rivets too. Easy to secure to the fencing.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cover my wife's Can Am spyder it works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: hskrfan1

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Thick and seemed heavy duty until we used it. First time we used it camping, three anchors ripped out and it wasn’t even windy. Too expensive for a 1-3 time use tarp. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Myeh...
customer_reviews.text: Myeh...blew out several of the grommets using normal bungees to hold down. Was expecting better quality. Couldn’t really return because I only had limited time to use to get my boat covered so, I guess it will have to do.
customer_reviews.author: Rocketron

customer_reviews.title: Its still looks great and its in the sun
customer_reviews.text: Its very tough. I tarp my Pop Up Camper. Its still looks great and its in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy francis

customer_reviews.title: Great tarp.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first purchase of this brand of tarps. Looks to be well made. I'll update my review after I've used it for a bit.
customer_reviews.author: DonkeyMom

customer_reviews.title: water leaked right through
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tarp to cover a boat and every time it rained i had to take the tarp off and dry out the boat. EVERY SINGLE TIME. As you can imagine my disappointment considering the price of the tarp. It is useless since it does not do what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Deebe10

customer_reviews.title: Boat
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cover my boat with a tower, this worked great and is very thick def waterproof, boat covers usually are not too bad but ones that work around a tower get way up there in price $600 this was a great alternative to make sure water stays out.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Well made and well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my use to keep construction materials out of the weather. Compares favorably to other tarps I have purchased elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be made well. Put on my car canopy.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyna Cicarelli

customer_reviews.title: Decent Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice heavy duty tarp that fit my needs at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Szolc

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: nothing heavy about this thing!!! first wind we had and the thing tore. Returning it
customer_reviews.author: Vintage Diva

customer_reviews.title: Wow they weren’t kidding when they said heavy duty very happy
customer_reviews.text: Great service can’t wait until I get it over my 10X20 carport For extra security and most of all extra protection
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rendon

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: If you don't expose it to the sun I suppose it might work. However, that kinda defeats the purpose...
customer_reviews.author: Neal J Hinerman

customer_reviews.title: Silver one side and brown on the other...not black as indicated in the description
customer_reviews.text: Silver one side and brown on the other...not black as indicated in the description
customer_reviews.author: Ollie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy tarp well reinforced, I would buy another one in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: LargeOne

customer_reviews.title: Great price and product!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty tarp! Better than the blue ones! Holding up to strong winter winds so far.
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a make-shift ceiling in a 10X16 storage building. Worked better than expected to keep the heat and air in. Great quality and very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Works at keeping out the rain perfectly and also cuts down on the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Caramelkisses72

customer_reviews.title: So far seems durable.
customer_reviews.text: So far doing very well. But it should since only had it a couple of months. Much better than the last one we ordered. Got it end of May and it was torn in shreds by end of summer.
customer_reviews.author: tduff

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my drift boat dryer in the winter. Everything I was hoping for. Cheers,
customer_reviews.author: Lefty

customer_reviews.title: It’s perfect!
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect! It’s heavy and with stood the heavy winds that are on my beach front house. I’m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Brothers

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Glad I ordered. I needed a thick and sturdy tarp for outdoor winter use.
customer_reviews.author: Jill :)

customer_reviews.title: grommets tore from tarp
customer_reviews.text: good if you are not going to use outside. I needed mine to cover something outside and once tired down the grommets tore loose from the tarp after just a few days of being tightly secured. Wish i would have spent a little more on a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough tarp
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tough tarp. Worth the money and I will buy again. Size was perfect too. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: dlkfarms

customer_reviews.title: HEAVY Duty - will buy a third.
customer_reviews.text: Brown backside with reflective silver topside. This is a heavy duty tarp (+*****)
customer_reviews.author: HeR3tic

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Work Tarp
customer_reviews.text: Good heavy duty tarps. We are using these for construction site floor protection, materials protection with people walking on them and working on them. These tarps will last through all of that abuse and be used on multiple jobs for possibly two years before we will need to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Tile Specialties Corp.

customer_reviews.title: It works fine and has some thickness
customer_reviews.text: This one was worth the money. I know they are a temporary-season-long investment to keep the hay dry until it is sold.
customer_reviews.author: Southwest Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Not all that heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this yesterday. I don't consider it to be heavy duty. It had a small tear in it out of the package. Also is seamed together in the center. I doubt it will last any more than 3 months. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tarp is good rings are weak. Won’t last long.
customer_reviews.text: I just received my order today. I use it as a cover for my dog kennel. when I put it up I noticed tears by the rings. Overall quality is pretty good but I’m sure it won’t last long. I would’ve returned it but for $20 It wasn’t worth my time. I’ll keep it as long as I can then Buy a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wicelinski

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tarp. It is really thick. Grommets are sturdy
customer_reviews.author: K. KalvelageTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: it been doing a great job. The materials feels heavy/thick and durable but ...
customer_reviews.text: Got the tarp to help protect some items in the back yard from the rain. So far, it been doing a great job. The materials feels heavy/thick and durable but still easy to handle. Can’t complain especially since it affordable and cheaper than Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Alora Huynh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Thicker than I thought!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tarp, thicker than I thought it would be. It's outside since I bought weeks ago, in sun and rain. Hoping it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Haskins

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great product I use it for packing BASE parachutes can fit 3 at once
customer_reviews.author: Mac McElroy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tarp, heavy gauge, perfecto to go under a tent.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Schuuz

customer_reviews.title: This tarp sucks!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought it and put it over a boat and within 2 weeks it tore right down the middle. We used duct tape and patched the rip, retied it, and less than 3 days later, it ripped in another place. DO NOT BUY THIS!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Norred

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I had it over my hot tub cover to protect the cover from the hot sun we have here and It ripped in less than 45 days. Not impressed at all and recommend you select a different brand tarp.... it just didn’t hold up.
customer_reviews.author: jeff Fewell

customer_reviews.title: Won't last long
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months covering my boat in the sun in NH this thing is brittle and has ripped out down one of the seams in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: MikeG

product_meta.title: B-Air Grizzly Tarps - Large Multi-Purpose, Waterproof, Heavy Duty Poly Tarp Cover - 10 Mil Thick (Silver - 20 x 30 Feet)
product_meta.description: Style:Pack of 1| Size Name:20X30| Color Name:SilverThe superior grade tarps by Grizzly Tarps are made from a tight 14x14 sq inch polyethylene weave which provides durability with 10 mil heavy duty thickness. This method of manufacture gives you a long-lasting cover that is lightweight and easy to handle. They are UV, water, and mildew proof. Grizzly Tarps further enforce their tarps with reinforced corners with black bar and 2 rivets to ensure stronger ends to avoid tears during stressful application. Supplied with built-in aluminum grommets to allow secure tie-downs along with 4 edges PP rope in hem. Tarps can be used as protection for boats, cars or motor vehicles, providing shelter from the elements, ie. , wind, rain or sunlight for campers, as an emergency roof patch material for homeowners, as a temporary pickup truck bed cover, and for a ground or drop sheet. No matter what application, Grizzly Tarps present a stronger more durable tarp that will provide the user with longevity for all covering or protective needs. Product Features 0 Mil Thickness Heavy Duty 14 x 14 Weave (Mesh) Reinforced Corners with Black Bar + 2 Rivets Aluminum Grommets 4 Edges PP Rope in Hem UV Proof Waterproof Mildew Proof Washable
feature_bullets: TIGHTLY WOVEN FABRIC: The B-Air Grizzly Tarps are constructed with tightly woven polyethylene fibers (True 14 x 14 weave) which provide superior durability and protection from UV, water, and mildew

WATERPROOF: B-Air Grizzly Tarps can be used to shelter boats, cars, campers or motor-vehicles from the elements (i.e. wind, rain or sunlight), as an emergency roof patch material for homeowners, and as a temporary pickup truck bed cover

LIGHTWEIGHT BUT DURABLE: All Blue Grizzly Tarps are enforced with border piping to insure stronger ends to avoid tears during stressful applications. Each tarp is 10 mil. thick, making them extremely lightweight and portable
BUILT-IN GROMMETS: Every B-Air Grizzly Tarp includes built-in aluminum grommets every 36" to allow secure tie-downs with reinforced black bar corners.
ULTIMATE PROTECTION: Choose the right tarp for the job - Grizzly Tarps have available sizes that range from 8 x 10 feet and get as large as 20 x 30 feet

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars573 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
